subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Edisons Inspiration??
author: Stefan Bion
full_text:
Hi Misty,

yes, but as mentioned in the article, the soundwaves engraved in smoke
on paper were never intended to be played at that time. So it was
actually in best a preliminary stage to the phonograph. In most cases,
inventions don't fall from the sky, and of course it seems very likely
that Edison had already heard of the "phonautograph" before he developed
his phonograph.

Stefan

-- 

> Yeah it makes one wonder. Then again this country not to mention the

> nobody knows about or told others about. I found the smoke thing 
> interesting tho. Never would have thought of that one so I was amazed 
> that someone else did so long before edisons work became the 
> forefront of technology. Considering the time frame it makes me 
> ponder if he had heard of the work or just the idea even was enough 
> to set his wheels turning and get him thinking in that direction.

> Misty
